isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - INSTALL - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

note.para: The left countershaft assembly MUST remain in time with main drive gear when timing right countershaft assembly.

step1.para: Remove blocking from right countershaft assembly and place it parallel to the mainshaft assembly. Mesh the marked tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 252).

figure.caption: Figure 252. Mesh Marked Teeth of Right Countershaft Drive Gear and Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Insert the countershaft support tool or blocking in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 253).

figure.caption: Figure 253. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Position the front countershaft bearing in the front bearing bore ( Figure 254). Use the proper bearing driver to set the bearing ( inset, Figure 254).

figure.caption: Figure 254. Position Front Countershaft Bearing in Front Bearing Bore and Set Bearing

step1.para: Install the retainer washer and bolt ( Figure 255). Make sure to match the roll pin in the retainer with the inner bearing hole.

figure.caption: Figure 255. Install Retainer Washer and Bolt

step1.para: Tighten the bolt to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N· m) ( Figure 256).
Position the countershaft rear bearing in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 257). Use a suitable bearing driver to seat the bearing in the bore.

figure.caption: Figure 257. Position Countershaft Rear Bearing in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: With bearing installation complete, install the snap ring in the right countershaft rear groove ( Figure 258).

figure.caption: Figure 258. Install Snap Ring in Right Countershaft Rear Groove

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear on the mainshaft and use a screwdriver to engage sliding clutches with all forward speed gears. A sliding clutch that will not engage with a gear indicates the gear set is not in proper mesh. The bearings of the right countershaft would then need to be removed and the drive gear set retimed.

note.para: Do not engage sliding clutches with more than one gear at the same time. This will lock the gearing and prevent the mainshaft and countershaft assemblies from rotating.
